section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will use best efforts to schedule and perform such maintenance between the hours of 8pm and 8am Eastern Standard Time on weekdays, or during weekends.
explanation: The first sentence states continuous operation, but the second sentence allows for maintenance. This creates a contradiction: If maintenance is required, the site is NOT continuously running.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: There is not enough information about what happens if the customer fails to pay the fees. "interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site" is too vague.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the 4 Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: This is a contradiction because one sentence states that it will automatically renew for one month, whereas the other sentence states that either party can terminate this agreement without cause at any time. The two sentences are contradictory because terminating an agreement is "cause."
